conclusion: To determine which blocks A will collide with and its final stop position, analyze the sequence of events based on the images provided.
A (the green toy car) is initially moving towards the red block, with the direction indicated by a red arrow pointing towards the red block.
A collides with the red block, causing the red block to move.
The collision is shown in the second image where the red block is displaced slightly, and A continues moving.
After colliding with the red block, A is deflected slightly towards the purple block due to the angle and force of the collision.
A then collides with the purple block, displacing it and continuing its movement in a different direction due to the impact.
After the collision with the purple block, A's movement is significantly slowed down or stopped.
The final position of A is near the purple block, slightly to the right of the red block.
The collisions with the red and purple blocks show how Aâ€™s energy is transferred to these blocks, altering their positions.
The deflection observed after each collision is due to the angle at which A hits the blocks, causing changes in its trajectory.
A will collide with the red and purple blocks. The final stop position of A will be near the purple block, slightly to the right of the red block.
